column4: I have a friend who aborted the Jaunty upgrade in the middle and now has no keyboard or mouse functionality in X.  He can CTRL-ALT-F2 to get to a terminal.  ifconfig shows no network adapters, just the loopback.  I have googled and found others in the same boat, but no solutions short of completely reinstalling.  I'd like to offer him some easier way, especially since he has many photos on his hard drive and no easy way to back
them up.  Advice?
from the terminal, mount a drive to back up.  Probably you _could_ fix it, but it's best to just complete the install.
He doesn't have a drive to mount at the moment.
ok.  use a remote copy program such as scp to copy everything to another computer then.
that assumes you can get ethernet working.
Yeah, it would be wonderful if we could get ethernet working - then I could SSH in and have a look myself, plus obviously we could back stuff up offsite.
Any advice on getting his network card to work?
is NetworkManager running?
how to tell?  ps ax |grep something?
grep NetworkManager I assume.
basically, if it is not, you want to add a line for eth0 in /etc/network/interfaces  Currently only lo will be in there.
or really, several lines starting with auto eth0          which will bring eth0 up.
where to add eth0?  /etc/network/interfaces has two lines: "auto lo" and "iface lo inet loopback"
man interfaces
man interfaces?
I looked at my own file, and it's the same as his, but of course my network driver is working fine.
the manual page
yes, the file is generally only used for lo, NetworkManager handles the rest.  However, the system isn't working; you can add other lines and bring up those interfaces.
the interfaces(5) manual page has some info as well various websites.
so:   auto eth0         next line: iface eth0 inet dhcp      would be a simple setup.
I just figured that out.  Thanks for validating my thoughts.  :-)
its been a while since I've messed with that.  You'll need to use ifup  to bring the interface up.
Thank you very much for the networking help - we eventually got it working and we're now SSHing and screening to work the rest out.
